caseSubject: Evacuee Property / Settlement/Sale of land to private school without lawful authority
caseTitle: American International School System thr. its Director v. Mian Muhammad Ramzan (decd) thr. LRs & others
tagline: Record shows that on mere desire of the then Chief Minister of Punjab, the Member (Colonies) Board of Revenue (BoR), Punjab doled out valuable "residual evacuee property" at a throw away price to the petitioner-School, knowing fully well that the subject property is not the State land and that the subject evacuee land could only be disposed off through open auction in terms of the Scheme for Management and Disposal of Available Urban Properties, 1977 (Scheme, 1977) and otherwise, he was not at all competent to undertake such exercise, which authority under the Scheme, 1977 vested in the Member, BoR (Residual Properties).The Chief Minister does not possess any plenary authority and or jurisdiction to allot any land as a matter of grace or favour at his whims and fancy, but in accordance with law.
